meta.content: This page contains COVID-19 information related to Blackduck Schools. ​It will be updated frequently, as information becomes available.

a.span: American Indian Parent Advisory Committee Notes

div.font: This page contains COVID-19 information related to Blackduck Schools.

br.font: ​It will be updated frequently, as information becomes available.

img.style: margin-top: 5px; margin-bottom: 10px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 10px; border-width:1px;padding:3px; max-width:100%

span.style: display: table-caption; caption-side: bottom; font-size: 90%; margin-top: -10px; margin-bottom: 10px; text-align: center;

strong.span: Keep your family and our community safe!

em.u: Center for Disease Control and Prevention

br.font: Everyone is being asked by the governor to stay home. If you must go out, keep a “social distance” which means at least six feet away from each other. ​This will help reduce the spread of COVID-19 and keep everyone healthy! Please continue to support our local businesses but be thoughtful about how you do that. We want to see everyone, students and staff, healthy and back in school as soon as possible!

strong.font: Blackduck Public Schools will be closed from March 18-May 3

font.font: , in accordance with the March 15th and March 25th orders from MN Governor Tim Waltz. ​Blackduck Schools will begin Distance Learning on Tuesday, March 31.

a.font: Meals for Students During the COVID-19 Statewide Schools Shutdown

br.span: Free meals for Tuesday - Friday will be provided for all Blackduck School students wanting them. Families wishing to receive free meals should see the Meals Service tab under the District's COVID-19 tab.
br.strong: This is only for families who have not signed up already.
Please do not fill out the form more than once.
br.font: To receive the free meals, families must reside within the Blackduck School District and have filled out the meal services form
Families in need of additional food assistance are encouraged to contact the Blackduck Resource Center at
(218) 835-5768 or Meghan Klein at mklein@blackduck.k12.mn.us. If the shutdown continues, the Bemidji United Way will also be a resource for families.
Childcare will be provided for essential employees only.

u.a: See the District Childcare page for more information.
